About us - Kings Road Brewing Company Search for: Search Menu 0 $ 0.00 0 $ 0.00 Home About us History Faqs News Our Blog Beer The Mug Club Events Medford Fall Festival Private Events Shop Gift Cards E-Gift Cards The Mug Club Contact Us Who We Are In 2017 five friends took their passion for craft beer to the next level by opening a brewery and tasting room in Haddonfield, New Jersey, a previously dry town. They envisioned a place where everyone could meet and share in their love of community and craft beer. Since then, they have proudly served some of the region‚Äôs freshest and finest hand-crafted ales and lagers to thousands of happy locals and visitors alike. Our Locations King‚Äôs Road Brewing Company has two locations. The original brewery and tasting room is located in the heart of Downtown Haddonfield . Our second  Brewery  is located in Medford, NJ . Haddonfield Brewery 131 Kings Hwy E,
Haddonfield, NJ 08033 Medford Brewery 67 North Main Street,
Medford, NJ 08055 The Mug Club The Mug Club is a fantastic gift for your friends, your family or yourself. Receive
an exclusive King‚Äôs Road Ceramic Beer Mug, and drink specially-priced pours
from your own personal mug each time you visit. JOIN NOW What Our Patrons Say "We went here the first time on Saturday.  We just moved to the area and are getting acclimated to our new town.  We decided to stop by because we love beer and were excited to see a brewery.  We were greeted by a very nice server who asked if we wanted outdoor or indoor service.  We requested outdoor and were taken to an amazing rear patio area.  Plenty of seating, great atmosphere and the beer was good too. A little disappointed there wasn't any food but I am not sure of this is COVID related or they simply do not serve food.  The wait staff were all extremely friendly and we will definitely come back." Sam Newman - Local ‚ÄúLove King's Road! This is the first brewing company in Haddonfield and they have delicious beers on tap. Perfect spot for happy hour or to pick up a growler to go.‚Äù Ben H - Local "This was our first visit to their new location. What a nice space! We tried three of their beers; Oktoberfest, Strata Sphere and El Dorado. All three were very enjoyable. Will definitely be back." Frank Clement - "King's Road has been an incredible addition to the Haddonfield community - both in their original location and in their expanded new home." Timothy Koeth - Local "A must stop if you're a beer lover. They always have a nice selection. The new location is beautiful with a large beer garden in the back." Laura Davidow - Local Nice brewery, with an old style ale house feel to it, with good beer and pleasant staff to boot. Located right in the heart of Haddonfield, I can't imagine it ever being uncrowded, but the folks in there aren't rowdy and getting served is a piece of cake. Toll Road Brewing Company Coming to Ocoee - RTR Sells Homes Skip to main content Menu Menu Market Reports RTR‚ÄôS Winter Garden Real Estate Report 2nd QTR 2025 RTR‚ÄôS Windermere Real Estate Report 2nd QTR 2025 Windermere 2025 1st Qtr Report Winter Garden 2025 1 Qtr Report Winter Garden Real Estate Market Report Windermere Real Estate Market Report Ron‚Äôs Cities Winter Garden Windermere Winter Park Hunters Creek Dr. Phillips Gotha Clermont Ocoee Selling Buying About Listings Reviews Blog Contact Press enter to begin your search Close Search Toll Road Brewing Company Coming to Ocoee Ronald Ziolkowski November 3, 2017 Breweries have become popular throughout Central Florida. A second brewery based in Ocoee is now coming to West Orange. Toll Road Brewing Company hopes to open their doors in mid-December. The brewery will be located on West McKey Street and operate Wednesday-Sunday. Toll Road Brewing Company‚Äôs three owners have 13 years of home-brewing experiences. They have used the last two years to fine-tune some of their favorite recipes and get feedback at beer festivals. The brewery is still in the build-out phase, but once completed, it should have a modern feel. Some of the design features include wooden accents and Edison bulb fixtures. There will also be windows in the taproom so customers can get a firsthand look at the brewing equipment in action. All beer, with the exception of ciders, will be brewed in-house. Some of the specific beers planned include a Citra Rye IPA, a pale ale and a peanut and chocolate porter. The Brewers‚Äô plan is to have five or six core beers and rotate out three to four other experimental beers. The owners crafted the name of Toll Road Brewing company based on the fact that the 408, 429 and Florida‚Äôs turnpike all have Ocoee exits. They are just the latest in a wave of projects to come to the city‚Äôs downtown. Toll Bridge Brewing Company NEWS BREWS ABOUT BLOG CONTACT Close √É¬ó NEWS BREWS ABOUT BLOG CONTACT THE BREWERY OF THE SAINT-SIXTUS ABBEY From our visit to Trappist Westvleteren From our visit to Trappist Westvleteren ST. BERNARDUS WATOU Lunch at the Bar Bernard Lunch at the Bar Bernard BREWERY HUYGHE Relaxing at the Delirium Cafe Amsterdam Relaxing at the Delirium Cafe Amsterdam TOLL BRIDGE BREWING Come visit us in Woodinville, Washington Come visit us in Woodinville, Washington WHAT'S HAPPENING In The Brewery News . Pretty Welcoming... if we say so ourselves! We are getting ready! We needed to send over some pictures of the taproom to the LCB... Here is a sneak-preview with all 
                the nice cushions all in place and all the sawdust cleaned up. SOOO VERY CLOSE! Raise a Toast! The glasses arrived May 15, 2025. I could not resist taking a glamour shot in the beer garden. It was a nice day, and the hops was all green 
                and made a prefect background for the set. And before you all go asking, yes, we will have them for sale. Beer in the Back We also needed to show the beer garden for the LCB. Once we finished setting it up, we wanted to sit out there ourselves! HA! Top WAITING ON LICENSING Our Portfolio ! Toll Bridge's products are high quality, easy-drinking, and √¢¬Ä¬úFiendishly Good.√¢¬Ä¬ù Our initial product
          portfolio contains approximately fourteen (14) products, with the main focus on our Belgian styles. We are
          currently developing a small portfolio of unique beers containing bread with freshly milled flours, our homage
          to the importance of bread as both foodstuff and ancient brewing ingredient. We are also developing several non-alcoholic beverages as well for our non-drinking friends. GoldieÃÅlach Belgian-style Blond Belgian-style blonde ale with a low but pleasing hop bitterness and low malt aroma that has a spiced and
            sometimes fruity ester character. It is medium in sweetness and not as bitter as its sibling. It is balanced
            between light sweetness, spice, and low to medium fruity ester flavors. 7.0% ABV ‚Ä¢ 28 IBU Six Voies Abbey-style Single Abbey-style single. Its name is French, meaning √¢¬Ä¬úsix lanes.√¢¬Ä¬ù The beer is a slightly sweet blonde ale, with
            the typical fruitiness of Belgian yeast. Not-so-typical (but not IPA) hoppiness finishes this refreshingly
            bright
            Belgian-inspired Abbey-style single. 6.0% ABV ‚Ä¢ 40 IBU Dubbel Trubbel Belgian-style Dubbel with Bread Belgian-style dubbel with a malty sweetness and cocoa and caramel aromas and flavors. Its hop bitterness
            is medium-low to medium. Yeast-generated fruity esters (especially banana) are balanced by extended lagering
            times. Bread using freshly milled heirloom wheat contributes a unique spicy character and a smoother
            mouthfeel. 8.3% ABV ‚Ä¢ 26 IBU Toll Bridge Brewing Tripel Belgian-style Tripel Belgian-style tripel with a mild spicy flavor and a yeast-driven complexity. This one is on the higher end
            of the ABV spectrum, yet is very approachable to many different palates. 9.2% ABV ‚Ä¢ 39 IBU Biere de Saison l'Apricot Saison with Apricot [seasonal] Belgian-style saison with some yeast character and high carbonation, a slight Brettanomyces/lactic
            character, and fruity aromas and flavors. Apricot puree is added to enhance the fruity characteristics of
            the yeast. 5.8% ABV ‚Ä¢ 22 IBU Teuflisch Belgian-style Golden Strong Ale Belgian-style golden strong ale, the pilsner of Belgium. It has the
            traditional characteristic spiciness from the Belgian yeast and a highly attenuated, dry finish. 9.5% ABV ‚Ä¢ 26 IBU Archangel Belgian-inspired IPA "Belgian" IPA with a heavenly taste, slightly aromatic and refreshingly fruity due to the use of four hop
            varieties. The yeast lends a nice spiciness reminiscent of our Teuflisch Golden Strong Ale. 7% ABV ‚Ä¢ 61 IBU Jimmy Classic American Pilsner A delicious historical reproduction of the Classic American Pilsner, this pilsner has a beautiful, full,
            golden color and a long-lasting, thick, creamy head. Its full flavor, with modest maltiness, is bolstered by
            the subtle sweetness of corn. The beer's yeast character is balanced by a well-defined hop bitterness. It
            has a
            long, clean, subtly bitter finish. 5.5% ABV ‚Ä¢ 42 IBU Porter / Pumpernickel Porter Seasonal Porters A robust porter featuring a bitter and roasted malt flavor reminiscent of cocoa.
            Its caramel and malty sweetness balances with the sharp bitterness of black malt. The hop
            bitterness is evident and some diacetyl is present at very low levels. The twist? A seasonal √¢¬Ä¬úPumpernickel
            Porter√¢¬Ä¬ù brewed with a Bavarian-style 100% rye bread made from freshly milled grain. 6.2% ABV ‚Ä¢ 40 IBU R'eyePA Flagship Rye IPA A Rye IPA, this beer is decidedly hoppy without being overly bitter. This is definitely a true Northwest
            IPA with the addition of a significant amount of rye malt.
            The balance is hop-forward, with a clean fermentation profile, dry finish, and clean, supporting malt
            flavors, allowing a creative range of hop character to shine through. It is drier and spicier than
            typical IPAs. 7.5% ABV ‚Ä¢ 88 IBU Hawai'IPA West Coast IPA Inspired by a brewery in Waimea, HI, and Kirkland, WA, this traditional West Coast IPA is characterized by
            a
            balanced floral, fruity hop character. The IPA is all about hop flavor, aroma and a moderate bitterness. 7.6% ABV ‚Ä¢ 67 IBU Schwarzbier German-Style Black Lager German-style Schwarzbier, or black lager. It is drier, darker and more roast-oriented than the dubbel. It
            has a nice, surprisingly pale-colored foam head and a mild
            roasted malt character without the associated bitterness. Its malt flavor and aroma is at low to medium
            levels of sweetness. 4.5% ABV ‚Ä¢ 40 IBU Maibock Seasonal Also called a √¢¬Ä¬úhellerbock√¢¬Ä¬ù (meaning √¢¬Ä¬úlighter bock√¢¬Ä¬ù), this German-style Maibock
            has a dominant malt-rich profile with lightly toasted and bready malt
            character with a pleasant caramel finish. Watch for our roasted habanero-infused seasonal! 8.0% ABV ‚Ä¢ 41 IBU Eigenbier Scottish-style Wee-Heavy [seasonal] Strong Scotch Ale with fruity, malty aromas leading to plummy vanilla flavors,
            finishing with a touch of oaky earthiness which nicely balances the dark malt nuttiness. One sip and you
            will not want to share it! 9.0% ABV ‚Ä¢ 38 IBU Ginger Ale Flight or Pint This ginger ale "flight" features three different ginger syrups: fresh ginger, fresh galangal, and a
            house blend. Blend your own or have a pint of the house blend. NON-AL Cream Ale Housemade Cream Soda One of our special housemade sodas, the first of many planned.
